text: explosion here we use a laser with a
wavelength of 650 nanometers first take
off the columnating lens of the laser
position the laser beam with close pin
after you connect it to batteries have
the laser warm up for two
minutes turn off the light and you
should see the bean spot the area should
be larger than your holographic
plate place your object in the middle of
the beam the object should be bright
when illuminated with the red laser and
it doesn't move or
deform you can place your holographic
plate on the top of your object for 20
seconds don't touch the table during
exposure any vibration will affect the
quality of interferent fringes
developing and
drying here we have a developer water
for rinsing bleach water for more
rinsing alcohol for drying and a place
to dry your holographic
plate developing should be done in the
dark to prevent a second exposure
use your tweezers to dip the plate in
the developer for 20 seconds until the
plate turns black and rinse it in water
for 1 minute
place a rinsed hologram into the
bleaching solution agitating until the
play is completed clear it takes up to 1
minute
and then rinse it in water for 1
minute place the finished hologram in
the wetting solution for 20 to 60
seconds it reduce the likelihood of
water spots and have it dry for 10
minutes
testing view the hologram with
incandescent light such as projector
flashlight spotlight or LED in the sun
